title: ‘My Broken Language’ Review: Piecing Together a Life of Many Dialects
description: In Quiara Alegría Hudes’s new play at the Signature Theater, five performers try to summon generations of willful women.
dc:creator: Alexis Soloski

media:content.media:credit: Richard Termine for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Foreground, from left, Daphne Rubin-Vega, Marilyn Torres and Zabryna Guevara with Samora la Perdida, standing left, and Yani Marin in “My Broken Language” at Signature Theater.
